TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit X509Certificate2Enumerator extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Supports a simple iteration over a object. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Enumerators provide read-only access to the data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator.Reset%2A> method also brings the enumerator back to this position. At this position, calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator.Current%2A> property throws an exception. Therefore, you must call the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator.Current%2A>.
This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface. For more information about enumerating over a collection, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.

Docs.summary: Gets the current element in the object.
Docs.value: The current element in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator> does not move the position of the enumerator. Consecutive calls to the Current property return the same object until either the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator.Reset%2A> method is called.

Docs.exception: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool MoveNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element in the object.
Docs.returns: if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method advances the enumerator to the next element in the collection. For more information about enumerating over a collection, see the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> topic.

Docs.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> or Reset method throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

Docs.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: The current element in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.

Docs.exception: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.returns: if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.

Docs.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Enumerator> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface.

Docs.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.
